About.subtitle: About Me
About.title: Full Stack Developer
About.p1: I'm <0>Kayo Weiber</0>, an Information Systems student at UEMG and a full-stack developer driven by the passion to turn ideas into meaningful software solutions.
About.p2: With over 4 years of experience in technical support and computer maintenance, I now focus on building scalable and efficient software.
About.p3: I'm currently expanding my skills with <0>Java</0> and Spring Boot, aiming to grow as a <1>more complete and versatile</1> developer.

services.webDesc: Modern and responsive websites focused on performance and UX.
services.backendDesc: Robust solutions with Node.js, Express, and JWT authentication.
services.apiDesc: System connections via RESTful APIs and efficient data handling.
services.javaSpringDesc: Secure and scalable apps built with Spring Boot framework.
services.frontendDesc: Rich interfaces using React, TypeScript and Tailwind CSS.
services.dbDesignDesc: Well-structured relational and NoSQL database projects.

proj1.title: Casa Lar Project
proj1.desc: Management platform for a group home with Registration, Financial, and Pedagogical modules.

proj2.title: Website for Volumetry
proj2.desc: Automates the calculation of the volume of canned beers to optimize operations control.

proj3.title: Portfolio Website
proj3.desc: I created this website to present my projects and skills in an interactive and modern way.

list.title: Introduction to Software Testing
list.description: I acquired knowledge about the fundamentals and importance of software testing to ensure quality, learning about different types of tests, such as unit and integration, and their role in the development cycle.

list.title: SOLID and Clean Code in Java: Writing High-Quality Code
list.description: I applied the five SOLID principles and Clean Code concepts in the context of the Java language to build robust, flexible, and easily maintainable software, following the best practices of object-oriented programming.

list.title: Introduction to Clean Code
list.description: I learned the essential principles for writing readable and easily maintainable code, focusing on techniques such as using meaningful names, creating functions with a single responsibility, and consistent code formatting.

list.title: MySQL
list.description: I learned to work with the MySQL relational database management system, focusing on data modeling and executing SQL queries to create, manipulate, and query information in a structured way.

list.title: AI Journey: Prompt Engineering
list.description: I trained in prompt engineering to interact effectively with Artificial Intelligence models, learning to structure clear and contextual instructions to generate accurate and optimized results.

list.title: Git and GitHub
list.description: I studied the Git version control system to manage project history and the use of GitHub to host remote repositories, collaborate in teams, and manage branches efficiently.

list.title: Introduction to Data Analysis - Microsoft Power BI
list.description: I developed skills to transform raw data into insights with Microsoft Power BI, learning to import, process data, and create interactive reports and dashboards for information visualization and analysis.

list.title: JavaScript
list.description: I deepened my knowledge in JavaScript, covering from basic syntax and DOM manipulation to fundamental concepts for creating interactivity on web pages, such as events, functions, and data structures.

list.title: Hardware
list.description: I studied the fundamental components that make up a computer, such as the processor, RAM, and motherboard. I learned about their functions, interconnections, and the basic principles of equipment assembly and maintenance.
